required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Reanimation in Tetraplegia: Restoring Cortical Control of Functional Movement in Humans With Quadriplegia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to allow the investigation of the Neural Bridging System for participants with tetraplegia to assess if the investigational device can reanimate a paralyzed limb under voluntary control by the participant's thoughts.

detailed_description.textblock: This study plans to enroll participants who have been diagnosed with C4- C6 ASIA A spinal cord injuries (motor and sensory complete neurologic injuries), who are more than 1 year post injury, and who are neurologically stable.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Voluntary Movement
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure of this study is the achievement of voluntary hand movement using the neural bridge system

arm_group.description: Neural bridge system implant and external stimulator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be 21 years or older.
- Must be tetraplegic (C4- C6 ASIA A).
- 12 months post injury and neurologically stable.
- Participant is willing to comply with all follow-up evaluations at the specified times.
- Participant is able to provide informed consent prior to enrollment in the study.
- The participant is fluent in English.
- Participant must have a caregiver willing to participate in the study who will provide care for the surgical site.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No active wound healing or skin breakdown issues.
- No history of poorly controlled autonomic dysreflexia.
- Medical contraindications for general anesthesia, craniotomy, or surgery.
- Diagnosis of acute myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest within previous 6 months.
- Participants with any type of destruction and/or damage to the motor cortex region as determined by MRI.
- History of psychiatric disturbance or dementia
- Other implantable devices such as heart/brain pacemakers
- Participants who rely on ventilators
- Co-morbid conditions that would interfere with study activities or response to treatment.
- History of a neurological ablation procedure.
- Labeled contraindication for MRI.
- History of hemorrhagic stroke.
- History of HIV infection or ongoing chronic infection (such as tuberculosis).
- Pregnant or of child-bearing potential and are not taking acceptable methods of contraception.
- Participation in another FDA device or medication trial that would interfere with the current study.

facility.name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center - Center for Neuromodulation

reported_events.desc: Adverse Events were monitored/assessed without regard to the specific Adverse Event Term, please consider making this explicit in the Adverse Event Reporting Description

group.title: Open Label
group.description: Neural bridge system implant and external stimulator Neural Bridge System: Implanted device

event.description: Change in psychological sense of self to include functions enabled by use of the neural bridge system, resulting in the participant keeping the neuroimplant (declining explant) at the completion of the study term - deemed a UPIRSO by the study IRB.

event.sub_title: Non-device related AE associated with spinal cord injury (anticipated)
event.description: Urinary tract infection and bladder stones associated with neurogenic bladder

event.sub_title: Non-device related AE associated with spinal cord injury (anticipated)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
